name: Cumberland County v. Lemoyne Trust Company, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Cumberland County v. Lemoyne Trust Co.

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Schaefer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
parties: Cumberland County v. Lemoyne Trust Company, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
A thorough examination of the record in this case convinces us that all questions raised for our consideration have been fully considered and correctly disposed of in the opinion of President Judge Reese. Nothing further need be added to what the learned trial judge has so well said.
Judgment affirmed at appellant’s costs.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: E. M. Biddle, Jr., with him John E. Myers, for appellant.
L. Floyd Hess, with him Caleb 8. Brinton, County Solicitor, for appellee.
John Y. 8eott, Deputy Attorney General, with him Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
casebody.head_matter:
Cumberland County v. Lemoyne Trust Company, Appellant.
Argued January 7, 1935.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Schaefer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
E. M. Biddle, Jr., with him John E. Myers, for appellant.
L. Floyd Hess, with him Caleb 8. Brinton, County Solicitor, for appellee.
John Y. 8eott, Deputy Attorney General, with him Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, for Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
March 25, 1935:
